required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study is to Understand the Treatment Patterns for Immunotherapy Agents and BRAF/MEK Inhibitors Used in the Treatment of Advanced Melanoma
clinical_study.official_title: Understanding the Treatment Patterns, Healthcare Resource Utilization, Costs of Care, and Clinical Outcomes Among Patients Treated for Advanced Melanoma

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the study is to understand the treatment patterns for immunotherapy agents and BRAF/MEK inhibitors used in the treatment of advanced melanoma

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients treated with immunotherapy and BRAF/MEK inhibitors

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients treated with immunotherapy and BRAF/MEK inhibitors

study_pop.textblock: Patients with advanced melanoma treated with immunotherapy and BRAF/MEK inhibitors

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must have ≥1 medical or pharmacy claim for nivolumab, ipilimumab, pembrolizumab, nivolumab+ipilimumab (on the same day), dabrafenib, vemurafenib, cobimetinib, trametinib, dabrafenib+trametinib (on the same day) and vemurafenib+cobimetinib (on the same day)
- Patients must have ≥6 months of continuous health plan enrollment prior to index date
- Patients must have ≥2 medical claims at least 30 days apart with a diagnosis for melanoma during the study period AND ≥1 diagnosis for melanoma during the baseline period prior to or on the index date
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with ≥1 claim for the agents of interest including immunotherapy agents and BRAF/MEK inhibitors between the first diagnosis of metastatic disease and the day prior to the index date will be excluded
- Patients with a claim for acquired immunodeficiency virus (AIDS) anytime during the study period
- Patients under the age of 18 as of index date
Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria could apply
